revision.comment: DFS certification seems to piggyback on the previous model (A4RNC2-6A5)
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Google |model=Chromecast |revision=2018 (NC2-6A5B) |est_release_date=10/2018 |fcc_date=05/04/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |availability=common |type=media streamer, computer-on-a-stick |fcc_id=A4RNC2-6A5B |ic_id=10395A-NC26A5 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88DE3006;88DE3006-BTK2; |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Toshiba |fla1_model=TC58NVG1S3HBAI6 |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B4G1646D-BYK0 |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8887 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |flags=Bluetooth LE, HDMI out, DFS (slave), |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac }} {{TagLine|Google Chromecast 2018}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.google.com/intl/en_us/chromecast/tv/chromecast}} <small> The Reference report Letter for ''Model NC2-6A5'' 4-25-18 document says that this device has :the same board and mechanical designs as the [[Google Chromecast 2015 (NC2-6A5)]] :but this version adds bluetooth functionality. Also, "This device has been changed to include a 0.5 mm trim on the 5GHz PCB antenna :trace that increases the 5GHz maximum antenna gain from 2.1 dBi to 4 dBi." </small>
{{FCC ST|10/28/2018|indexme.}} *{{WPLink|Chromecast}}
